column3:
John thought about things that he liked to do.
ewline
ewlineWell, for one, he liked baseball. Compared to his friends, he was very good at the
ewlinesport. He didn't even have to practice that much. He remembered that he once hit the ball
ewlineso hard that it flew out of the park. Home run!
ewline
ewlineHe was also a fan of basketball. He enjoyed watching people on television pull off crazy
ewlinetricks like slam dunking (but he didn't really like all of the passes). He wasn't quite
ewlinethat good yet, but he was pretty good at making shots from the three point line. He knew
ewlinethat if he kept practicing, he would be really great someday.
ewline
ewlineFinally, he loved football. Unlike baseball and basketball, he didn't play football
ewlinehimself, but he was drawn to the games. He got a kick out of sitting in the stands,
ewlinecheering on his team and friends. He once cheered so loud that he could barely speak at
ewlineall for the rest of the day.
column4: multiple: Based on what John likes to do, what else do you think John would enjoy?
column9: one: What kind of crazy basketball tricks does John enjoy?
column14: multiple: Why is John proud of his baseball skills?
column16: He once got a home run
column17: He practiced every day and every night
column19: multiple: What kind of things does John like?
